coverages.details: Covers non-refundable overseas transport and accommodation expenses paid in advance if the trip is cancelled due to unforeseen circumstances like serious sickness (including COVID-19 under specific conditions). The event causing cancellation must occur after policy purchase and within 30 days before departure (unless accidental). Policy must be bought at least 3 days before departure (unless the event is accidental). COVID-19 eligibility requires meeting vaccination/test requirements and the illness must be serious.
coverages.source_info: Page 5, Section 1; Page 3; Page 10, Note 5; Page 11, Note 10

coverages.details: Covers additional administration charges for postponing the trip due to specified unforeseen events.

limits.type: Limit for extra expenses to return to Singapore (Per person)

coverages.details: Covers non-refundable expenses and additional travel costs if the trip is cut short due to unforeseen circumstances like serious sickness (including COVID-19 under specific conditions). COVID-19 eligibility requires meeting vaccination/test requirements and the illness must be serious.
coverages.source_info: Page 5, Section 3; Page 3; Page 10, Note 5; Page 11, Note 10

limits.type: Limit for accommodation expenses per room per night

coverages.details: Covers additional travel or accommodation expenses incurred due to trip disruption caused by specified events.
Pays for delays of scheduled public transport exceeding 6 consecutive hours, provided the delay is not caused by the insured. Requires confirmation from the carrier.
Covers additional travel expenses to reach the destination due to missing a connection, caused by the late arrival of the incoming connecting public transport.
Pays if the insured is denied boarding on scheduled public transport due to overbooking and no alternative is provided within 6 hours.

coverages.coverage_name: If the travel agency becomes insolvent
coverages.details: Covers loss of travel or accommodation costs paid in advance due to insolvency of the travel agency. Not covered under post-departure purchase.

limits.type: Delay arriving in Singapore (after 6 hours) - Adult
Delay arriving in Singapore (after 6 hours) - Child

coverages.details: Covers the purchase of essential clothing and toiletries if checked-in baggage is delayed for more than 6 consecutive hours.

coverages.coverage_name: Loss or damage of baggage and personal belongings

limits.type: Limit for watches, jewellery or valuables in total
Limit for other items (for each item, set or pair)

coverages.details: Covers accidental loss or damage to baggage, clothing, personal belongings, and valuables during the trip.
Covers loss of cash or traveller's cheques due to theft, robbery or burglary during the trip.

limits.type: Limit for accommodation expenses per room per night

coverages.details: Covers costs incurred to replace lost passport, travel tickets, and other travel documents, plus related additional travel and accommodation expenses.

coverage_categories.category_name: Personal Accident and Medical Expenses Benefits

coverages.details: Provides lump sum payment based on a scale of compensation for accidental death or permanent disability occurring during the trip. Scale includes: Accidental death (100%), Permanent total disability (100%), Loss of two or more limbs/sight in both eyes (100%), Loss of one limb/sight in one eye (50%), Loss of speech/hearing (50%).

coverages.coverage_name: Public transport double cover for accidental death
coverages.details: Pays double the accidental death benefit if death occurs while travelling as a fare-paying passenger on public transport.

limits.type: Adult 70 years old or over (Combined limit for sections 14, 18, 19)
Limit for medical aids and equipment

coverages.details: Covers necessary medical treatment expenses incurred overseas due to accidental injury or illness (including COVID-19) during the trip. Standard plans do not cover pre-existing medical conditions. COVID-19 cover requires meeting vaccination/test requirements.
coverages.source_info: Page 7, Section 14; Page 3; Page 5; Page 11, Note 10

limits.type: Limit for medical aids and equipment

coverages.details: Covers medical expenses incurred in Singapore for follow-up treatment within a specified period after returning, for an injury or illness first treated overseas. COVID-19 is excluded from this section's cover.

coverages.coverage_name: Treatment by a Chinese medicine practitioner or a chiropractor
coverages.details: Covers expenses for treatment by a registered Chinese medicine practitioner or chiropractor overseas or as follow-up treatment in Singapore, subject to policy conditions and requirements.
Pays a daily cash benefit for each full 24-hour period of hospitalisation overseas due to injury or illness.

Covers reasonable costs for emergency medical evacuation to the nearest suitable medical facility or transport back to Singapore if medically necessary. The limit for adults 70+ is combined with Sections 14 and 19.

Covers the cost of returning the insured's mortal remains to Singapore or cost of local burial/cremation overseas, OR the travel costs for one relative to assist if the insured dies overseas. The limit for adults 70+ is combined with Sections 14 and 18.

limits.type: Limit for accommodation expenses per room per night

coverages.details: Covers the travel and accommodation expenses for one relative or friend to travel to the insured if the insured is hospitalised overseas for more than a specified number of consecutive days.
Pays a daily benefit if the insured is unlawfully detained overseas for ransom.
Covers overseas telephone charges incurred for contacting emergency assistance provider following a covered event.

limits.type: Limit per item (for each item, set or pair)

coverages.details: Covers loss or damage to household contents due to fire or burglary at the insured's home in Singapore while the insured is overseas on the trip.
Covers the insured's legal liability for accidentally causing bodily injury to other persons or loss/damage to their property during the trip.
Reimburses the insurance excess or deductible the insured is liable to pay under the rental vehicle agreement due to loss or damage to the rented vehicle.

Extends cover under sections 1 to 25 for losses directly caused by an act of terrorism. The limits shown are the maximum payable for terrorism claims under the relevant sections and are part of, not in addition to, those section limits.

limits.limit: See limits of respective sections that apply (Sections 1 to 25 except section 15)

coverages.details: Provides cover under various sections (e.g., Trip Cancellation/Shortening, Medical Expenses Overseas, Emergency Evacuation) if the insured contracts COVID-19, subject to fulfilling vaccination/testing requirements imposed by destination/carrier and meeting specific section conditions (e.g., trip cancellation requires serious sickness). Excludes cover for Medical Expenses in Singapore (Section 15).
coverages.source_info: Page 9, Section 27; Page 11, Note 10; Page 3; Page 10, Note 5

limits.limit: Covered up to the limits of the relevant section (e.g., Medical Expenses, Personal Accident)

coverages.details: Covers participation in recreational adventurous activities done for leisure, such as scuba diving (PADI certified or with instructor, max 30m depth), skiing, snowboarding, hiking/trekking (below 4,000m, public access or organised tour/guide), bungee jumping, skydiving, etc. Must comply with safety procedures, use safety equipment, and follow guidance/supervision of licensed guides/instructors where applicable. Excludes extreme sports involving high speed, height, danger, specialized gear or stunts.

Covers 1 or 2 adults (spouses/partners, >=16 years, parent/guardian) and an unlimited number of their children (biological/adopted/ward, <21 years). All must be insured under the same policy. For single trip plans, all insured persons must travel together.

Coverage period is automatically extended for up to 14 days at no extra cost if the insured is unable to return to Singapore before the policy expires due to delay of public transport (not caused by insured) or hospitalisation as advised by a medical practitioner.

limits.limit: See limits of respective sections that apply (Sections 3 to 27 except section 8)

coverages.details: Allows purchase of per-trip plans within one day after departing Singapore. Provides cover under Sections 3 to 27 (excluding Section 8 - Travel Agency Insolvency). Does not cover claims arising from transport taken before purchase, known events, or losses that occurred before purchase.
